title: The Skill That Everyone Is Missing
description:
Ready to build a network of amazing women and high-status men?

Michael’s Men of Action is a one-on-one Master’s program that teaches men how to create elite social lives by becoming higher status.

Click this link to learn how you can have a High-Status lifestyle now:
https://m.moamentoring.com/podcast

Click here to join the Men of Action community and watch the High-Status Networking 101 course:
https://m.moamentoring.com/moa-community
————————————————————

Subscribe on Youtube: 
https://www.youtube.com/user/MichaelSartain

Listen on Apple Podcast: 
https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-michael-sartain-podcast/id1579791157

Listen on Spotify: 
https://open.spotify.com/show/2faAYwvDD9Bvkpwv6umlPO?si=8Q3ak9HnSlKjuChsTXr6YQ&dl_branch=1

channel_info.title: Michael Sartain
channel_info.description:
🎙Host of The Michael Sartain Podcast 

🔥Teaching you how to build a network of desirable women and high-status men

👇 Click the "Men of Action" link below now to forge a high-status lifestyle and join the elites

transcription: {"text": "When you avoid confrontation, you create conflict. Those difficult discussions you have, you want to have them early, and you want to give them a long time to just get everybody to get everything out, and you want to have them with as little emotion as possible. The passive-aggressive behavior is 99% of the problems that I have in my life. It's people who, like, believe a rumor or don't like something that I did and will not confront me about that thing, and it's generally because their passive-aggressive behavior is based in jealousy or a misunderstanding. The thing I found is that most people are like this. Most people avoid confrontation whenever they can, and I find that to be a horrible, horrible problem, especially when it comes to self-help. When you can be that person that always comes to other people, it's like, hey, man, we don't have to like each other. I understand. Kobe and Shaq, we don't have to like each other. We don't, but we have to play together. So let's work this thing out so that we can have an amicable relationship, and I've done that before with people, and I'm like, listen, brother, I understand. You're just not gonna like me. You're not gonna like me because I like this football team or because your ex-girlfriend flirts with me or whatever, but we have to work together, and if you have a problem, let's talk about this with each other first, and then we can go on and do other things and work it out.
